diff_hunk:

   def __new__(cls, features, labels, receiver_tensors):
     # Both features and labels can be dicts or raw tensors.

body: Yes, it does convert raw tensors into a dict before the check, but the end result remains the same and it doesn't affect the user code in any way. You can still pass raw tensors in, and `_wrap_and_check_input_tensors` will take care of adding in the default keys.
body_html: Yes, it does convert raw tensors into a dict before the check, but the end result remains the same and it doesn't affect the user code in any way. You can still pass raw tensors in, and _wrap_and_check_input_tensors will take care of adding in the default keys.
body_text: Yes, it does convert raw tensors into a dict before the check, but the end result remains the same and it doesn't affect the user code in any way. You can still pass raw tensors in, and _wrap_and_check_input_tensors will take care of adding in the default keys.
